segment.source: How to Create a Custom Configuration File by Using the App-V 5.0 Management Console
segment.target: How to Create a Custom Configuration File by Using the App-V 5.0 Management Console

segment.source: How to Create a Custom Configuration File by Using the App-V 5.0 Management Console
segment.target: How to Create a Custom Configuration File by Using the App-V 5.0 Management Console

segment.source: How to Create a Custom Configuration File by Using the App-V 5.0 Management Console
segment.target: How to Create a Custom Configuration File by Using the App-V 5.0 Management Console

segment.source: You can use a dynamic configuration to customize an App-V 5.0 package for a specific user.
segment.target: You can use a dynamic configuration to customize an App-V 5.0 package for a specific user.

segment.source: However, you must first create the dynamic user configuration (.xml) file or the dynamic deployment configuration file before you can use the files.
segment.target: However, you must first create the dynamic user configuration (.xml) file or the dynamic deployment configuration file before you can use the files.

segment.source: Creation of the file is an advanced manual operation.
segment.target: Creation of the file is an advanced manual operation.

segment.source: For general information about dynamic user configuration files, see, About App-V 5.0 Dynamic Configuration.
segment.target: For general information about dynamic user configuration files, see, About App-V 5.0 Dynamic Configuration.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to create a Dynamic User Configuration file by using the App-V 5.0 Management console.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to create a Dynamic User Configuration file by using the App-V 5.0 Management console.

segment.source: To create a Dynamic User Configuration file
segment.target: To create a Dynamic User Configuration file

segment.source: Right-click the name of the package that you want to view and select Edit active directory access to view the configuration that is assigned to a given user group.
segment.target: Right-click the name of the package that you want to view and select Edit active directory access to view the configuration that is assigned to a given user group.

segment.source: Alternatively, select the package, and click Edit.
segment.target: Alternatively, select the package, and click Edit.

segment.source: Using the list of AD Entities with Access, select the AD group that you want to customize.
segment.target: Using the list of AD Entities with Access, select the AD group that you want to customize.

segment.source: Select Custom from the drop-down list, if it is not already selected.
segment.target: Select Custom from the drop-down list, if it is not already selected.

segment.source: A link named Edit will be displayed.
segment.target: A link named Edit will be displayed.

segment.source: Click Edit.
segment.target: Click Edit.

segment.source: The Dynamic User Configuration that is assigned to the AD Group will be displayed.
segment.target: The Dynamic User Configuration that is assigned to the AD Group will be displayed.

segment.source: Click Advanced, and then click Export Configuration.
segment.target: Click Advanced, and then click Export Configuration.

segment.source: Type in a filename and click Save.
segment.target: Type in a filename and click Save.

segment.source: Now you can edit the file to configure a package for a user.
segment.target: Now you can edit the file to configure a package for a user.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?
